channel.title: CVE Feed for BUFFALO INC. -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for BUFFALO INC. -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-46711|2024-09-12T18:44:42.909Z -- buffalo%20inc. -- vr-s1000
item.description: VR-S1000 firmware Ver. 2.37 and earlier uses a hard-coded cryptographic key which may allow an attacker to analyze the password of a specific product user.

item.title: CVE-2024-44072|2024-09-10T06:56:44.182Z -- buffalo%20inc. -- whr-1166dhp2
item.description: OS command injection vulnerability exists in BUFFALO wireless LAN routers and wireless LAN repeaters. If a user logs in to the management page and sends a specially crafted request to the affected product from the product's specific management page, an arbitrary OS command may be executed.

item.title: CVE-2024-23486|2024-07-05T15:05:31.047Z -- buffalo%20inc. -- wsr-2533dhp
item.description: Plaintext storage of a password issue exists in BUFFALO wireless LAN routers, which may allow a network-adjacent unauthenticated attacker with access to the product's login page may obtain configured credentials.

item.title: CVE-2024-23486|2024-04-15T10:50:01.778Z -- buffalo%20inc. -- wsr-2533dhp
item.description: Plaintext storage of a password issue exists in BUFFALO wireless LAN routers, which may allow a network-adjacent unauthenticated attacker with access to the product's login page may obtain configured credentials.

item.title: CVE-2024-26023|2024-04-15T10:51:04.093Z -- buffalo%20inc. -- wcr-1166ds
item.description: OS command injection vulnerability in BUFFALO wireless LAN routers allows a logged-in user to execute arbitrary OS commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-26023|2024-07-15T16:10:17.826Z -- buffalo%20inc. -- wcr-1166ds
item.description: OS command injection vulnerability in BUFFALO wireless LAN routers allows a logged-in user to execute arbitrary OS commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-44072|2024-09-10T19:58:39.140Z -- buffalo%20inc. -- whr-1166dhp2
item.description: OS command injection vulnerability exists in BUFFALO wireless LAN routers and wireless LAN repeaters. If a user logs in to the management page and sends a specially crafted request to the affected product from the product's specific management page, an arbitrary OS command may be executed.
